summary: Build STEP 1 visuals: a full-screen cinematic theatre/stage scene with fixed centered hub logo and background silhouette logo, with strict asset validation and fail-loudly missing-asset overlay.
architectural_notes: Strict STEP 1 scope only: do not add ECG, heartbeat audio, carousel, artist cards, redirects/links, or any additional UI beyond specified visuals.
Asset handling: must use exact filenames; no substitutions or placeholders; missing asset triggers a blocking full-screen overlay with exact message.
Add an explicit asset rescan step that outputs/list detected project files before continuing (for verification of required exact filenames).

existing_features.title: Implement strict startup asset validation for the following exact filenames: logo2.png, jacques-johnson.png, kream-kuntree.png, rl-stafford.png. If any of these assets cannot be found/loaded, render a full-screen blocking overlay that says exactly: “MISSING ASSET: [filename] — DO NOT SUBSTITUTE”. Do not render placeholders or substitute alternative assets.

Create a full-screen cinematic theatre/stage environment (visuals only) with a pure black base background and readable/brighter rendering (avoid crushed blacks). The scene must include: heavy theatre curtains on the left and right with deep folds; a visible auditorium feel with subtle seats/rows on both sides; a central aisle/walkway; warm aisle lights along the walkway; visible overhead rigging/truss with hanging spotlights; and subtle volumetric light beams (soft haze) suitable for performance lighting.

Render logo2.png as a large, dominant, fixed centerpiece exactly centered in the viewport. Ensure it is layered above the curtains/scene (correct z-index). Add a very faint halo/orbit ring around the centered hub (thin, feathered, low opacity).

Add a huge background silhouette/shadow version of logo2.png behind the environment and center hub logo. It must be a single, non-tiled instance sized to approximately 140–180% of viewport width, very low opacity, dark, and still recognizable.

After startup asset validation completes, present a blocking “Asset Scan Results” screen that lists each required asset filename (logo2.png, jacques-johnson.png, kream-kuntree.png, rl-stafford.png) and whether it was successfully detected/loaded, and require the user to explicitly continue before the theatre scene renders. If any required asset is missing, keep the existing strict missing-asset behavior (full-screen overlay with the exact message) and do not allow continuing.

Rescan project assets and list all detected files before proceeding (to confirm required exact filenames are present).
